API Documentation¶

Contents:

  • Using the API
  • Installation

Quick start¶

Explore the API at: https://api.pma2020.org/v1/resources

Summary¶

Resource Operation Description
Characteristic groups GET /v1/characteristicGroups Get collection of characteristic
  GET /v1/characteristicGroups/(code) Access a specific characteristic
Countries GET /v1/countries Get collection of countries.
  GET /v1/countries/(code) Access a specific country by its code.
Data GET /v1/data Access de-identified survey data.
  GET /v1/data/(code) Access a specific datum by its code.
Datalab GET /v1/datalab/combos Datalab client specific endpoint for querying valid
  GET /v1/datalab/data Datalab client specific endpoint for querying data.
  GET /v1/datalab/init Datalab client specific endpoint for app
Docs GET /docs Redirects to official documentation.
Indicators GET /v1/indicators Get collection of available indicators.
  GET /v1/indicators/(code) Access a specific indicator by its code
Resources list GET /v1/resources Lists all of the available API resources and
Root GET /v1/ Redirects to resources list or documentation depending
  GET /  
Survey rounds GET /v1/surveys Get collection of survey rounds.
  GET /v1/surveys/(code) Access a specific survey round by its code
Text GET /v1/texts Get collection of various text related to surveys and
  GET /v1/texts/(code) Access a specific piece of text by its code
Version GET /version API versioning data.

API Details¶

GET /v1/datalab/combos¶

Datalab client endpoint for querying validmetadata combinations.

The structural metadata for Datalab are:
  • Country survey rounds
  • Indicators
  • Characteristics for data disaggregation
A valid structural metadata combination is a combination for which data
exists. That is to say that when these metadata are used together as query parameters on the ‘datalab/data’ endpoint, actual data will be returned rather than nothing at all.
Returns:
json: List of valid metadata combinations.
GET /v1/datalab/data¶

Datalab client endpoint for querying data.

Returns:
json: Queried data.
GET /v1/datalab/init¶

Datalab client endpoint for app initialization.

Returns:
json: All of the necessary elements to render initial view of Datalab.
GET /v1/characteristicGroups¶

Get Characteristic Groups resource collection.

Returns:
json: Collection for resource.
GET /v1/indicators¶

Get Indicator resource collection.

Returns:
json: Collection for resource.
GET /v1/countries¶

Country resource collection GET method.

Returns:
json: Collection for resource.
GET /v1/resources¶

Return API resource routes.

Returns:
json: List of resources.
GET /v1/surveys¶

Survey resource collection GET method.

Returns:
json: Collection for resource.
GET /v1/texts¶

Get Text resource collection.

Returns:
json: Collection for resource.
GET /v1/data¶

Get Data resource collection.

Returns:
json: Collection for resource.
GET /version¶

Show API version data.

Returns:
String: Version number.
GET /docs¶

Documentation.

Returns:
redirect(): Redirects to official documentation.
GET /v1/¶

Root route.

Returns:
func: get_resources() if ‘application/json’ func: redirect to docs if ‘text/html’
GET /¶

Root route.

Returns:
func: get_resources() if ‘application/json’ func: redirect to docs if ‘text/html’
GET /v1/characteristicGroups/(code)¶

Get Characteristic Groups resource entity.

Args:
code (str): Identification for resource entity.
Returns:
json: Entity of resource.
GET /v1/indicators/(code)¶

Get Indicator resource entity.

Args:
code (str): Identification for resource entity.
Returns:
json: Entity of resource.
GET /v1/countries/(code)¶

Country resource entity GET method.

Args:
code (str): Identification for resource entity.
Returns:
json: Entity of resource.
GET /v1/surveys/(code)¶

Survey resource entity GET method.

Args:
code (str): Identification for resource entity.
Returns:
json: Entity of resource.
GET /v1/texts/(code)¶

Get Text resource entity.

Args:
code (str): Identification for resource entity.
Returns:
json: Entity of resource.
GET /v1/data/(code)¶

Get data resource entity.

Args:
code (str): Identification for resource entity.
Returns:
json: Entity of resource.
